abstract: The nation’s second-largest mortgage lender said Tuesday that it would take a $1.4 billion fourth-quarter charge for losses it anticipated in connection with home loans.
snippet: The nation’s second-largest mortgage lender said Tuesday that it would take a $1.4 billion fourth-quarter charge for losses it anticipated in connection with home loans.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo & Company, the nation’s second-largest mortgage lender, after Countrywide Financial, said yesterday that it would take a $1.4 billion fourth-quarter charge for losses it anticipated in connection with home loans.

headline.main: Bracing for Home Loan Losses, Wells Fargo to Take Big Charge
headline.print_headline: Bracing for Home Loan Losses, Wells Fargo to Take Big Charge

abstract: Wells Fargo & Company, the nation’s second-largest mortgage lender, said Tuesday that it would take a $1.4 billion fourth-quarter charge for losses it anticipated in connection with home loans.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo & Company, the nation’s second-largest mortgage lender, said Tuesday that it would take a $1.4 billion fourth-quarter charge for losses it anticipated in connection with home loans.

headline.main: Wells Fargo to Take Big Charge on Loan Losses
